page.title: 01HINDERCLAY & THELNETHAM
page.content: The block covers virtually the whole of Hinderclay, most of Thelnetham and a small portion of Redgrave; with a very narrow strip of Blo Norton. With the exception of this strip of Norfolk the area is situated in Suffolk. In the North-east corner is the dual source of the rivers Waveney and Little Ouse. The Waveney flows East while the Ouse flows West along the northern edge to form the boundary between Norfolk & Suffolk. The population of the entire block is only 440. The houses range from some with 15th Century timber-frames to brick built modern houses. Most houses are detached but a few, mostly Council built, are semi-detached. No major roads run through the area, only narrow country lanes. The nearest railway station is at Diss which is on the main London line.
